message.content: This question tests our understanding of the states of matter. Solid matter is characterized by having a definite shape and volume. An egg in a carton is an example of a solid because it maintains its shape and volume. Option (B) is incorrect because molten copper in a vat is in the liquid state. Option (C) is incorrect because water in a glass is also in the liquid state. Option (D) is incorrect because mercury in a thermometer is in the liquid state.

This question requires knowledge about the three states of matter: solid, liquid, and gas. A solid is a state of matter that has a definite shape and volume, with particles that are closely packed together. Option (A) is the correct answer because an egg in a carton is a solid. Option (B) is incorrect because molten copper is a liquid, as it has a specific volume but takes the shape of its container. Option (C) is incorrect because water is a liquid, as it takes the shape of its container and has a specific volume. Option (D) is incorrect because mercury is a liquid, as it takes the shape of its container and has a specific volume.

This question involves understanding the different states of matter. Solid matter refers to substances that have a fixed shape and volume. When an egg is in a carton, it maintains its shape and volume, making it an example of a solid. Option (B) is incorrect because molten copper is in its liquid state and does not have a fixed shape. Option (C) is incorrect because water is in its liquid state and also does not have a fixed shape. Option (D) is incorrect because mercury is in its liquid state in a thermometer and does not have a fixed shape.

Option (C) is incorrect because water is a liquid and does not have a definite shape. Option (D) is incorrect because mercury is a liquid and does not have a definite shape.

Option (A), an egg in a carton, represents solid matter because an egg has a definite shape and volume. An egg in a carton is an example of solid matter because it has a fixed shape and volume, and its particles are tightly packed. Option (B) is liquid matter because molten copper is melted copper and takes the shape of its container. Option (C) is liquid matter because water takes the shape of its container.
